intro: Aglaia wangii var. macrophylla, commonly known as the large-leaf aglaia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, glossy, ovate leaves that can reach up to 30 cm in length. The plant produces small, fragrant yellow flowers arranged in clusters, followed by elliptical, yellowish-orange fruits. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in lowland rainforests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant in tropical regions.
